alert.note: Alert for Harmon; Jackson (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 11:53PM CDT until June 01 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Harmon County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southwestern Jackson County in southwestern Oklahoma... Hardeman County in northern Texas... Northwestern Wilbarger County in northern Texas... * Until 345 AM CDT. * At 1153 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Quanah, Chillicothe, Medicine Mound, Goodlett, Odell and Fargo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
